alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:54AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SWITZERLAND, CARROLL, SOUTHERN KENTON, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHERN GRANT, NORTHWESTERN OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 545 AM EST... At 454 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Carrollton, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Independence, Carrollton, Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Vevay, Warsaw, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Glencoe, Ghent, Sanders, Sparta, Patriot, Worthville, Prestonville, Visalia, Atwood and Ryle. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 157 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
